data.title: Great Starbucks
data.text: Good stopping place in Down City if out and about, or walking by to the Mall. Large location, with lots of comfy seating, and wifi.

data.title: Average Starbucks
data.text: We stayed a the Biltmore and enjoyed the easy access to Starbucks twice during our stay for coffee and quick to-go breakfast.  Friendly staff, and yummy breakfast sandwiches/wraps.  The only thing I hate (which I hate about all Starbucks) is the too-small single area to add cream, sugar,etc. and generally get what you need together.  It is messy, creates backups of people waiting because there is only one and it is too small.  Also,it would be nice if they offered a non-lactose milk or creamer.

data.title: the manager was excellent, employees not so much
data.text: The employees on several times were so rude that the Manager actually gave us a starbucks gift card.  SHOCKED at the Starbucks.

data.title: Consistent coffee, with slow service
data.text: I like Starbucks coffee.  It is consistent from outlet to outlet.  Strangely, as nice as Starbucks, Dorrance Street is, the service was unnervingly slow.  During my 15 minute wait for a double espresso there were 10 other customers waiting for their coffee.  One clerk tended the orders, as second heated the prepackaged breakfast and lunch sandwiches, and the barrista tended the coffee machine.  The coffee was good, but as the song suggests, fast food ain't good enought to be slow, no.

data.title: It's a Starbucks...just like any other
data.text: It's a Starbucks.  If you've walked into one of thousands you know exactly what you are getting.  But it's right in the Biltmore so you can grab a quick cup first thing in the morning without bothering with room service or the typical hotel room coffee pot.

data.title: Convenient
data.text:
Attached to the Biltmore hotel which was perfect for a quick snack or coffee break. 
Access from hotel and the street.

data.title: A consistent chain store
data.text: Just what you would expect from a Starbucks.  Friendly staff, good service.   We visited mid day and there were no line ups

data.title: Nice big Starbucks, comfy leather couches, nice place to hang out
data.text:
We enjoyed a few coffees here, during our week staying at the Biltmore - usual Starbucks menu but nice big store, comfortable lounges and chairs, fireplace, nice atmosphere.
Only thing we found strange - there were two men sleeping on the wide windowsill, with their bags- not sure if they were homeless men or just weary travellers waiting for a bus?  Not offensive or anything, just strange ...

data.title: Fast!
data.text: Well organiz2e and fun location. Fast service and order was correct. Lovely spot. Friendly staff. Good snacks and sandwiches.

data.title: Fast!
data.text: Came here for a quick coffee and croissant while staying at the Omni down the street.  The service was really fast and friendly and everything tasted perfect!!

data.title: Is starbucks ever bad
data.text: I like the Flat White with soy. The little yogurt and fruits are a great breakfast starter. Lots of room to sit. Friendly staff.

data.title: Very Friendly
data.text: If you ever see my reviews you will see the thing that most influences them, I have found, is how I am treated.  I am an excellent cook, have a comfortable home and make terrific coffee so the thing I appreciate most is being treated well.  And that can be said of my visit at the Starbucks in the Biltmore Hotel.  We came in close to closing and we were not rushed.  We had a seven year old that wanted a McDonald's Chocolate shake.  The manager was very patient in explaining what on the menu was the best substitute, and did it with a great sense of humor.  She was not insulted at all.  It was  good to have a familiar place to get an excellent drink while staying at a hotel that in my considered opinion did not serve the best coffee.

data.title: Great spot for your moring/afternoon/evenong cup
data.text: Great coffee and nice staff. A spacious Starbuck's if there ever was one.Very convenient to the Biltmore Hotel... Enter from the lobby.

data.title: Good service
data.text: Visiting Rhode Island found a Starbucks within walking distance of my hotel. Very pleasant and fast service.  Just the way I like it.

data.title: Handy and right in the hotel
data.text: Always nice to know that Starbucks is close by.  Being Canadian I missing blonde aka "True North" had to settle for Pike. Oh well, nice to know that WIFI is always available.  Great snacks when you are surfing and relaxing.

data.title: UNUSUAL STARBUCKS
data.text: Not a usual Starbucks--older furniture & right on the street. Waitstaff helpful. Rest room locked up & not easily accessible. Sort of a hang out spot if you need one.

data.title: Great service
data.text: Kind waitstaff and good people there. They were very patient with me taking my order even though I like to take my time and in doing so irritate the people behind me. Wonderful people who made my frap the way I like it.

data.title: It's Starbuck's
data.text: Fairly typical Starbuck's visit. Small outlet with big prices. Convenient as it is right inside the Providence Biltmore hotel.

data.title: Just okay
data.text: Not great customer service. Definitely what I am used to at other Starbucks. Perhaps it was a continuation of the hotel.

data.title: Cold morning
data.text: Coffee and service was excellent but it was a 8 below outside and with the door opening all the time the cafe was freezing.    We had to take our food back to our hotel room to eat because it was too cold in Starbucks.
